description: A large black cockatoo from southeastern Australia, with distinctive yellow patches on its cheeks and yellow panels in its long tail. They have a crest that curls forward.
temperament: Generally gentle for a large parrot, but they are not common in aviculture. They are active, social birds with a very powerful beak.
loudness: Very Loud. They have a very loud, high-pitched, wailing call that can be heard from far away, often described as 'kee-ow'.
vocalization: Not known for talking ability. Their vocalizations consist of their loud, natural calls.
dietaryNeeds: A specialized diet consisting of seeds from native trees like banksia, hakea, and pine cones, as well as wood-boring grubs.
healthPointers: Can live for 60+ years. Rarely kept as pets and require a very experienced keeper. They need a huge amount of space and a specialized diet.
housing: Requires a very large outdoor aviary with plenty of wood to destroy. Not suitable for an indoor or home environment.
